p: The new compound, penochalasin K 343 was tested for its antifungal activity against four phytopathogenic fungi including C. musae, C. gloeosporioides, P. italicm, and R. solani. Compound 343 displayed excellent selective activities against the two phytopathogenic fungi Colletotrichum gloeosporioides (Penz) Sacc. ( C. gloeosporioides), and Rhizoctonia solani Kühn (R. solani), with MIC values of 6.13 µM and 12.26 µM, respectively. Moreover, the activity towards C. gloeosporioides and R. solani were about ten-fold and two-fold better than those of the positive control carbendazim, respectively. Whereas only moderate or weak inhibitory activities were exhibited by compound 343 towards Colletotrichum musae (Berk. and M. A. Curtis) Arx. ( C. musae) and Penicillium italicum Wehme ( P. italicm). Carbendazim and the solvent were adopted as positive and negative control, respectively. The MIC values of Carbendazim against C. gloeosporioides, R. solani, C. musae and P. italicm were 65.38 µM, 32.69 µM, 32.69 µM and 16.34 µM [ 114].
